str2: Woe!, alas!, uttered in grief or denunciation. A primary exclamation of grief; 'woe'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.
And, even, also, namely.
Of Hebrew origin; a separatist, i.e. Exclusively religious; a Pharisean, i.e. Jewish sectary.
From hupokrinomai; an actor under an assumed character, i.e. a dissembler

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To lead or carry about (or around), go about, traverse. From peri and ago; to take around; reflexively, to walk around.
Dry, withered; noun: dry land. From the base of xestes; arid; by implication, shrunken, earth.
And, even, also, namely.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
From the alternate of proserchomai; an arriver from a foreign region, i.e., an acceder to Judaism.
And, even, also, namely.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Double, two-fold. From dis and the base of pleion; two-fold.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
Of Hebrew origin; valley of Hinnom; ge-henna, a valley of Jerusalem, used as a name for the place of everlasting punishment.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
